headline.main: ‘The Black Swan: The Impact of the Highly Improbable’

docs.lead_paragraph: “The central idea of this book concerns our blindness with respect to randomness, particularly the large deviations . . . ”
docs.snippet: “The central idea of this book concerns our blindness with respect to randomness, particularly the large deviations . . . ”

headline.seo: Martin Amis - Kingsley Amis - Writing and Writers - Books - Authors

docs.lead_paragraph: A look at the curious writerly firm of Amis & Amis, founded by Kingsley Amis, an indelible figure in British letters, and run today by his son Martin, a more daring and inventive novelist than his father.
docs.snippet: A look at the curious writerly firm of Amis & Amis, founded by Kingsley Amis, an indelible figure in British letters, and run today by his son Martin, a more daring and inventive novelist than his father.
